ai-dn6:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-dn6:1.3_0: Now at that time several brahmin emissaries from Kosala and Magadha were residing in Vesālī on some business.
ai-dn6:1.5_0: “It seems the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—is staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-dn6:1.7_0: ‘He is indeed a Master, perfected and fully awakened, complete in insight and conduct, happy, knower of the world, supreme trainer of tamable people, teacher of gods and humans, the Master, the Buddha.
ai-dn6:1.8_0: With his own insight he has seen this world with its gods, its lords of death, and its supreme beings, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans, and he makes it known to others.
ai-dn6:1.9_0: He teaches Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely complete and pure.
ai-dn6:1.10_0: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”
ai-dn6:2.1_0: Then they went to the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood to see the Buddha.
ai-dn6:2.2_0: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was his carer.
ai-dn6:2.3_0: The brahmin emissaries went up to him.
ai-dn6:2.4_0: “Master Nāgita, where is Master Gotama at present?
ai-dn6:2.5_0: For I want to see him.”
ai-dn6:2.6_0: “It’s the wrong time to see the Buddha; he is on retreat.”
ai-dn6:2.7_0: So right there the brahmin emissaries sat down to one side, thinking,
ai-dn6:2.8_0: “We’ll go only after we’ve seen Master Gotama.”
ai-dn6:3.1_0: Oṭṭhaddha the Licchavi together with a large assembly of Licchavis also approached the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
ai-dn6:3.1_2: He bowed, stood to one side, and said to Nāgita,
ai-dn6:3.2_0: “Master Nāgita, where is the Blessed One at present, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha?
ai-dn6:3.3_0: For I want to see him.”
ai-dn6:3.4_0: “It’s the wrong time to see the Buddha; he is on retreat.”
ai-dn6:3.5_0: So right there Oṭṭhaddha also sat down to one side, thinking,
ai-dn6:3.6_0: “I’ll go and visit the Buddha, the perfected and fully awakened one.”
ai-dn6:4.1_0: Then the novice Sīha approached him.
ai-dn6:4.1_2: He bowed, stood to one side, and said to Nāgita,
ai-dn6:4.2_0: “Sir, Kassapa, these several brahmin emissaries from Kosala and Magadha were here to see the Buddha.
ai-dn6:4.2_1: Oṭṭhaddha the Licchavi together with a large assembly of Licchavis also come here to see the Buddha. It’d be good if these people got to see the Buddha.”
ai-dn6:4.3_0: “Well then, Sīha, please tell the Buddha about this.”
ai-dn6:4.4_2: He went to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and told him of the people waiting to see him, adding:
ai-dn6:4.5_0: “Sir, these several brahmin emissaries from Kosala and Magadha, and also Oṭṭhaddha the Licchavi together with a large assembly of Licchavis, have come here to see the Buddha.
ai-dn6:4.6_0: “Sir, it’d be good if these people got to see the Buddha.”
ai-dn6:4.7_0: “Well then, Sīha, spread out a seat in the shade of the dwelling.”
ai-dn6:4.8_0: “Yes, sir,” replied Sīha, and he did so.
ai-dn6:4.9_0: Then the Buddha came out of his dwelling and sat in the shade of the dwelling on the seat spread out.
ai-dn6:5.1_0: Then the brahmin emissaries went up to the Buddha, and
ai-dn6:5.2_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side,
ai-dn6:5.3_0: Oṭṭhaddha the Licchavi together with a large assembly of Licchavis also went up to the Buddha.
ai-dn6:5.3_3: “Sir, a few days ago Sunakkhatta the Licchavi came to me.
ai-dn6:5.4_0: ‘Mahāli, soon I will have been living in dependence on the Buddha for three years. I see heavenly sights that are pleasant, sensual, and arousing, but I don’t hear heavenly sounds that are pleasant, sensual, and arousing.’
ai-dn6:5.5_0: The heavenly sounds that Sunakkhatta cannot hear: do such sounds really exist or not?”
ai-dn6:5.7_0: “Such sounds really do exist, but Sunakkhatta cannot hear them.”
ai-dn6:6.1_0: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why Sunakkhatta cannot hear them, even though they really do exist?”
ai-dn6:6.2_0: “Mahāli, take a mendicant who has developed one-sided immersion to the eastern quarter so as to see heavenly sights but not to hear heavenly sounds.
ai-dn6:6.3_0: When they have developed immersion for that purpose,
ai-dn6:6.4_0: they see heavenly sights but don’t hear heavenly sounds.
ai-dn6:6.6_0: Because that is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.
ai-dn6:7.1_0: Furthermore, take a mendicant who has developed two-sided immersion to the southern quarter ...
ai-dn6:7.8_0: That is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.
ai-dn6:8.1_0: Take a mendicant who has developed one-sided immersion to the eastern quarter so as to hear heavenly sounds but not to see heavenly sights.
ai-dn6:8.2_0: When they have developed immersion for that purpose,
ai-dn6:8.3_0: they hear heavenly sounds but don’t see heavenly sights.
ai-dn6:8.5_0: Because that is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.
ai-dn6:9.1_0: Furthermore, take a mendicant who has developed two-sided immersion to the southern quarter ...
ai-dn6:9.8_0: That is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.
ai-dn6:10.1_0: Take a mendicant who has developed two-sided immersion to the eastern quarter so as to both hear heavenly sounds and see heavenly sights.
ai-dn6:10.2_0: When they have developed immersion for that purpose,
ai-dn6:10.3_0: they both see heavenly sights and hear heavenly sounds.
ai-dn6:10.5_0: Because that is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.
ai-dn6:11.1_0: Furthermore, take a mendicant who has developed two-sided immersion to the southern quarter ...
ai-dn6:11.8_0: That is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.
ai-dn6:11.9_0: This is the cause, Mahāli, this is the reason why Sunakkhatta cannot hear heavenly sounds that are pleasant, sensual, and arousing, even though they really do exist.”
ai-dn6:12.1_0: “Surely the mendicants must lead the spiritual life under the Buddha for the sake of realizing such a development of immersion?”
ai-dn6:12.2_0: “No, Mahāli, the mendicants don’t lead the spiritual life under me for the sake of realizing such a development of immersion.
ai-dn6:12.3_0: There are other things that are finer, for the sake of which the mendicants lead the spiritual life under me.”
ai-dn6:13.1_0: “But sir, what are those finer things?”
ai-dn6:13.2_0: “Firstly, Mahāli, with the ending of three fetters a mendicant is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
ai-dn6:13.3_0: This is one of the finer things for the sake of which the mendicants lead the spiritual life under me.
ai-dn6:13.4_0: Furthermore, a mendicant—with the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion—is a once-returner. They come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.
ai-dn6:13.5_0: This is one of the finer things for the sake of which the mendicants lead the spiritual life under me.
ai-dn6:13.6_0: Furthermore, with the ending of the five lower fetters, a mendicant is reborn spontaneously and will become extinguished there, not liable to return from that world.
ai-dn6:13.7_0: This is one of the finer things for the sake of which the mendicants lead the spiritual life under me.
ai-dn6:13.8_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-dn6:13.9_0: This is one of the finer things for the sake of which the mendicants lead the spiritual life under me.
ai-dn6:13.10_0: These are the finer things, for the sake of which the mendicants lead the spiritual life under me.”
ai-dn6:14.1_0: “But, sir, is there a path and a practice for realizing these things?”
ai-dn6:14.4_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-dn6:14.5_0: They are: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-dn6:14.6_0: This is the path and the practice for realizing these things.
ai-dn6:15.1_0: This one time, Mahāli, I was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-dn6:15.3_0: the wanderer Muṇḍiya and Jāliya the pupil of Dārupattika—came and approached it.
ai-dn6:15.4_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they stood to one side and said,
ai-dn6:15.4_1: Then they went forth to me and stood to one side.
ai-dn6:15.5_0: ‘Reverend Gotama, are the soul and the body the same thing, or they are different things?’
ai-dn6:16.1_0: ‘Well then, reverends, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.’
ai-dn6:16.4_0: ‘Take the case when a Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha ...
ai-dn6:16.5_0: That’s how a mendicant is accomplished in ethics.
ai-dn6:16.7_0: They enter and remain in the first absorption.
ai-dn6:16.9_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things”?’
ai-dn6:16.11_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things”.
ai-dn6:16.14_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things” ...
ai-dn6:17.3_0: enters and remains in the fourth absorption.
ai-dn6:17.5_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things”?’
ai-dn6:17.7_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things”.
ai-dn6:17.10_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things” ...
ai-dn6:18.1_0: they extend and project it toward knowledge and vision ...
ai-dn6:18.3_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things”?’
ai-dn6:18.6_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things”.
ai-dn6:18.9_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things” ...
ai-dn6:19.1_0: They understand: “... there is no return to any state of existence.”
ai-dn6:19.3_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things”?’
ai-dn6:19.5_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things”.
ai-dn6:19.8_0: “The soul and the body are the same thing” or “The soul and the body are different things”.’”
ai-dn6:19.9_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-dn6:19.10_0: Satisfied, Oṭṭhaddha the Licchavi was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-dn6:19.11_0: The sixth section on Mahāli is finished.
